title: Sweet Rice Recipe
description: Sweet rice, known as arroz con leche, is a lovely custard-like Mexican rice pudding with raisins, lightly flavored with cream, vanilla, and cinnamon.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Latin American Mexican Sweet Rice 4.5 (61) 49 Reviews 10 Photos This sweet rice (arroz con leche) is a custard-like dessert. Everyone loves this traditional Mexican rice pudding. You might want to double the recipe! Submitted by crys7422 Updated on November 25, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 10 10 10 10 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 cups water 1 cup uncooked long-grain white rice 2 tablespoons unsalted butter 3 cups whole milk, divided ⅓ cup white sugar 1 large egg 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour 1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract ⅔ cup heavy cream ½ cup raisins (Optional) ½ teaspoon ground cinnamon Directions Bring water, rice, and butter to a boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes. Whisk together 2 cups milk, sugar, egg, flour, and vanilla in a bowl; pour over cooked rice in the saucepan and stir to combine. Bring to a simmer over low heat and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes. Stir in remaining 1 cup milk, cream, raisins, and cinnamon until thoroughly mixed. Let cool for a few minutes. Serve warm or cold. I Made It Print 168 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 418 Calories 19g Fat 54g Carbs 9g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 418 % Daily Value * Total Fat 19g 24% Saturated Fat 11g 56% Cholesterol 90mg 30% Sodium 76mg 3% Total Carbohydrate 54g 20% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 24g Protein 9g 17% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 181mg 14% Iron 2mg 9% Potassium 334mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Sweet Rice 01 of 10 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 10 Photo by  PerkyPork2560 08/05/2022 I did not use flour or heavy cream or raisins and I used park water and part milk in the cooking process in the beginning. 03 of 10 Photo by  Vic 11/22/2019 04 of 10 Photo by  April Lucas 01/01/2017 Sweet Rice and Raisins. I added additional real vanilla extract and additional raisins (my husband likes it this way). Doing this gave pudding a bit darker color. I also add the raisins earlier into the simmering rice to plump raisins up a bit (if you do this add a bit more water when boiling rice to account for raisins to swell). Like this reciepe a great deal, easy to make. Use whole milk and cream to make it very rich and pudding like. 05 of 10 Photo by  Riena 10/25/2016 06 of 10 Photo by  haventreasures 08/17/2016 I had to add an additional 1/3 c sugar. Turned out great!! 07 of 10 Photo by  Stuffy Jenks 11/03/2015 It's good, but more bland than I expected. Only tried it warm so far, and this is my first attempt at rice pudding. The raisins tie everything else together in my opinion-- I wouldn't leave them out . 08 of 10 Photo by  kaysadeeya 12/31/2014 09 of 10 Photo by  SHORECOOK 01/13/2011 SMOOTH & CREAMY! This is not overly sweet. I thought I had made it wrong because it wasn't thick like other rice puddings. I researched Arroz con Leche and found it is "soupier" than American rice puddings. I cooked it a little longer to thicken to my preference, and once it cooled, it was perfect. SMOOTH & CREAMY! Thank you crys7422 for sharing your recipe. I learned something new tonight! 1 You’ll Also Love Arroz con Leche (Mexican Rice Pudding) 34 Ratings Original Mexican Flan Napolitano 3 Ratings Coconut Flan 50 Ratings Jericallas (Mexican Baked Custards) 3 Ratings Natillas (Mexican Custard) Mango Pudding (Flan de Mango) 19 Ratings Microwave Flan 25 Ratings Arroz con Leche 70 Ratings Flan I 58 Ratings Arroz con Leche (Rice Pudding) 21 Ratings Coconut Cheese Flan (Flan de Coco y Queso) 47 Ratings Pumpkin Pie Flan 19 Ratings Pina Colada Flan 9 Ratings Chocolate Pralines, Mexican Style 7 Ratings Best Old-Fashioned Creamy Rice Pudding 843 Ratings Mexican Pecan Cookies 22 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.;Whisk together 2 cups milk, sugar, egg, flour, and vanilla in a bowl; pour over cooked rice in the saucepan and stir to combine. Bring to a simmer over low heat and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes.;Stir in remaining 1 cup milk, cream, raisins, and cinnamon until thoroughly mixed. Let cool for a few minutes. Serve warm or cold.
